alert.note: Alert for Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hart, west central Anderson and southeastern Oconee Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Hartwell, or near Reed Creek, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Northlake, Reed Creek, Anderson Airport, Lake Hartwell, Townville, Sandy Springs, Fair Play and Sadlers Creek State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
